rationale: No matching field found in the target schema.
Both 'tissue_id' in the source schema and 'parent_sample_id' in the target schema represent unique IDs of the sample used for the assay.
No corresponding date-time field found in the target schema.
Both fields refer to the protocols.io DOI for describing preparation or assay processes, though the target schema focuses on sample procurement and preparation.
No matching field found in the target schema for the assay operator's name.
No corresponding field for the operator's email in the target schema.
No matching field found in the target schema for the principal investigator's name.
No corresponding field for the principal investigator's email in the target schema.
No clear match for assay categories in the target schema.
Both 'assay_type' and 'dataset_type' refer to the specific type of assay being performed.
Both fields describe the analytes being measured, with the same values and description.
Both fields specify whether a specific molecule is targeted for detection or measurement.
Both fields represent the vendor of the acquisition instrument, with identical meanings.
Both fields describe the model of the acquisition instrument, matching exactly.
'ms_source' and 'ms_ionization_technique' both refer to the ion source used in mass spectrometry, but differ slightly in their terminology.
Both fields refer to the polarity (positive or negative ion mode) used in the mass analysis.
Both fields refer to the low value of the scanned mass-to-charge range (MS1).
Both fields refer to the high value of the scanned mass-to-charge range (MS1).
No matching field found for resolution in the target schema.
No matching field found for resolution in the target schema.
Both fields describe preparation methods, but 'matrix_deposition_method' is specific to matrix deposition in imaging mass spectrometry.
Both fields describe the vendor of the preparation instrument used for the assay.
Both fields describe the model of the preparation instrument used for the assay.
Both fields describe the matrix used in the MALDI process, with identical meanings.
Both fields refer to the protocols.io DOI for tissue section preparation protocols.
'overall_protocols_io_doi' and 'analysis_protocol_doi' both refer to protocols for assay processes, but differ in their specific focus (overall vs. analysis).
Both fields refer to the path for the contributors file, with identical meanings.
Both fields refer to the path for data files, with identical meanings.
